intro: Dasistoma quercifolia, commonly known as the oak-leaved dasistoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that resemble those of an oak tree. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil types.
